name: Jalapeño Lime Chicken Soup
description: This simple and healthy Jalapeño Lime Chicken Soup has white beans, salsa verde, and a hit of fresh jalapeño and lime juice.
keywords: jalapeno lime chicken soup, chicken soup, jalapeno soup
recipeIngredient: 2 jalapeños, ribs and seeds removed, minced
half of a red onion, minced
1 pound boneless skinless chicken breasts or thighs
2 14-ounce cans white beans, drained (canellini or great northern)
fresh cilantro, sour cream, and shredded cheese for serving

recipeInstructions.text: In a soup pot over medium heat, saute the onion and jalapeno with the olive oil until soft and fragrant.

Add the water and salt. Bring to a boil. Add the raw chicken breasts. Cover and cook for 5-10 minutes. Remove from heat, but leave the lid on so that the chicken continues cooking for another 20 minutes. Remove the chicken breasts, set aside to cool.
Add the white beans and salsa to the pot. Simmer for 30 minutes over medium heat.
Shred the chicken and add it back to the pot.

Just before serving, squeeze the juice of one lime into the pot. Cut the remaining lime into wedges for serving. Add the salt; taste and adjust as needed. Serve with fresh cilantro, sour cream, and shredded cheese.

video.name: Jalapeno Lime Chicken Soup
video.description: Jalapeño Lime Chicken Soup! Simple and healthy with white beans, salsa verde, and a hit of fresh jalapeño and lime juice. YUM.

review.reviewBody: Oh gosh, this sounds and looks incredible Lindsay! I tried your wild rice soup and loved it - 5 stars for sure!
If there's a jalapeno involved, I am all-in! Thanks for this great recipe. I can always find a reason to pick up a jar of salsa verde.
Looks delicious. We make a chicken tortilla soup w Jalapeños (sometimes Habaneros but those can be really spicy!) This is definitely a keeper. Love your food pictures btw, gorgeous stuff!

This has my name written all over it! I'm obsessed with lime anything right now, so this totally fits the bill.

I've registered for a food processor on our wedding registry...having to wait until next September is killing me!
